nodes.bodyText:
For now, this document is substantially a legacy document for upgrading from 1.8.0.9 to 1.9.0.0.3266, and has never been updated past 1.9.0.0.3266 (I believe it misses several items that were made after that version, but I don't remember what). So the wording should accord to that.

Apparently, I'm still not being clear enough. If you change "isParatroop" to "isAirTransportable" you are NOT updating the map: You are changing it. As far as I know, the "isParatroop" option was doing nothing. I assume it was supported doing nothing just to avoid the game crashing if present.
Feel free to propose changes to how I explained the items at the "already deprecated and ineffective XML deletions, for all the respective attachments" section. I'm not sure how to improve it, while keeping it fairly concise. This is the explanation I gave:

(these items were already deprecated and were also ineffective, so you shouldn't have had these in your games already and, if you did, they were doing nothing)
Within every game file (XML), inside the "games" folder inside the main folder of the map, delete the whole  containing the code.

As far as I know, having "isParatroop" equals having nothing. It doesn't equal having a same valued "isAirTransportable" (unless the value is false, of course).
